direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are fundamental for object comparison and hash-based collections, ensuring consistent behavior in equality checks and hash code generation.
Both methods involve comparison logic, with isEqualKey focusing on key equality within the map context.
Similar to isEqualKey, this method focuses on value equality, sharing the comparison logic pattern with equals.
Both methods involve checking the presence of an element (key in this case) within the map, though with different outcomes.
Similar to containsKey, this method checks for the presence of a value, sharing a similar behavioral pattern with equals.
The get method relies on the key comparison logic similar to equals, making it a dependent method in terms of key validation.
The put method involves key validation which is closely related to the equals method, ensuring that the key is unique or matches an existing one.
The remove method also relies on key comparison, similar to equals, to identify and remove the correct entry.
The equals method in AbstractHashedMap serves the same purpose as in SingletonMap, providing a consistent way to compare maps.
Similar to SingletonMap's hashCode, this method ensures consistent hash code generation for hash-based collections.
